accomplishments.item: Part of an engineering team engineering a technical rewrite of Zipcar's member website, a browser based application in React, Redux, and Typescript
Managed complex requirements gathering between various groups within organization

Led architecture and development of several epics, including the creation of a new endpoint to allow account administrators to access the member website, as well as the creation of a large reusable component to be shared across technical teams in the organization
Pair and mob programming with members of the team of varying backgrounds and levels of experience
Liaison between UX design and member website engineering team, to discuss technical feasibility of prototypes and establish best practices for interactivity, accessibility and user experience
Developed component driven architecture of a once legacy, net new application from the ground up using Webpack, Yarn, React, Axios, and Redux as the first site upgrade in more than a decade

Improved user experience, interactivity, and efficiency of data handling for client Global Paymentsâ€™ web application Business View, allowing merchants to easily manage the lifecycle of credit card transactions
Wrote a lightweight internationalization framework for 5 languages, allowing users to dynamically change application language
Identified, compiled, and documented common UI elements to be a part of a React component library for easy implementation into other Global Payments applications using React Catalog
Liaison between UX design and member website engineering team, to discuss technical feasibility of prototypes and establish best practices for interactivity, accessibility and user experience
Part of a team that developed primarily for a large tobacco company who pose their product as a unique lifestyle brand

Transitioned jQuery-heavy legacy codebase into a modular, component driven architecture using React on a PHP/Laravel back end, increasing performance, optimization, and reducing complexity of code base
Crafted an HTML email automation workflow using Gulp and npm, reducing email development time by 90%

Architected a custom gantt chart application for team account coordinators to designate which builds should go on a particular QA environment using AngularJS, Google Sheets API, Express, node.js and Gulp
